kwargs.content: You are an experienced xml developer, who specializes in migrating code from spring5 to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+

I will give you a spring5 file for which I want to take one step towards migrating to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+.

I will provide you with static source code analysis information highlighting an issue which needs to be addressed.

Fix all the issues described. Other problems will be solved in subsequent steps so it is unnecessary to handle them now.

Before attempting to migrate the code to eap and eap8 and jakarta-ee and jakarta-ee9+ and jws and jws6+ and spring6+ reason through what changes are required and why.

Pay attention to changes you make and impacts to external dependencies in the pom.xml as well as changes to imports we need to consider.

Remember when updating or adding annotations that the class must be imported.

As you make changes that impact the pom.xml or imports, be sure you explain what needs to be updated.

After you have shared your step by step thinking, provide a full output of the updated file.

# Input information

## Input File

File name: "pom.xml"
Source file contents:
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project 
    xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" 
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.redhat.coolstore</groupId>
    <artifactId>monolith</artifactId>
    <version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>war</packaging>
    <name>coolstore-monolith</name>
    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.build.timestamp.format>yyyyMMdd'T'HHmmss</maven.build.timestamp.format>
        <project.encoding>UTF-8</project.encoding>
        <maven.test.skip>true</maven.test.skip>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>jakarta.platform</groupId>
            <artifactId>jakarta.jakartaee-api</artifactId>
            <version>8.0.0</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jboss.spec.javax.jms</groupId>
            <artifactId>jboss-jms-api_2.0_spec</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.0.Final</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.flywaydb</groupId>
            <artifactId>flyway-core</artifactId>
            <version>4.1.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jboss.spec.javax.rmi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jboss-rmi-api_1.0_spec</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.2.Final</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
    <build>
        <finalName>ROOT</finalName>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <encoding>${project.encoding}</encoding>
                    <source>1.8</source>
                    <target>1.8</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-war-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.2.0</version>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    <profiles>
<!-- TODO: Add OpenShift profile here -->
    </profiles>
</project>
```

## Issues


### incident 0
incident to fix: "Update artifact dependency by replacing the `javaee-web-api` artifactId with `jakarta.jakartaee-web-api`"
Line number: 20



# Output Instructions
Structure your output in Markdown format such as:

## Reasoning
Write the step by step reasoning in this markdown section. If you are unsure of a step or reasoning, clearly state you are unsure and why.

## Updated xml File
```xml
// Write the updated file in this section. If the file should be removed, make the content of the updated file a comment explaining it should be removed.
```

## Additional Information (optional)

If you have any additional details or steps that need to be performed, put it here.

## Reasoning

The issue is asking to update the artifact dependency by replacing the `javaee-web-api` artifactId with `jakarta.jakartaee-web-api`. However, upon reviewing the provided pom.xml file, I notice that there is no `javaee-web-api` artifactId present. Instead, there is a `jakarta.jakartaee-api` artifactId which is already using the Jakarta namespace.

However, I suspect that the issue might be referring to the fact that `jakarta.jakartaee-api` is a full Jakarta EE API, whereas `jakarta.jakartaee-web-api` is a subset of the full API that only includes the web profile. 

To address this issue, I will update the `jakarta.jakartaee-api` artifactId to `jakarta.jakartaee-web-api` to use the web profile API instead of the full API.

## Updated xml File

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project 
    xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" 
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>com.redhat.coolstore</groupId>
    <artifactId>monolith</artifactId>
    <version>1.0.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <packaging>war</packaging>
    <name>coolstore-monolith</name>
    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <maven.build.timestamp.format>yyyyMMdd'T'HHmmss</maven.build.timestamp.format>
        <project.encoding>UTF-8</project.encoding>
        <maven.test.skip>true</maven.test.skip>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>jakarta.platform</groupId>
            <artifactId>jakarta.jakartaee-web-api</artifactId>
            <version>8.0.0</version>
            <scope>provided</scope>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jboss.spec.javax.jms</groupId>
            <artifactId>jboss-jms-api_2.0_spec</artifactId>
            <version>2.0.0.Final</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.flywaydb</groupId>
            <artifactId>flyway-core</artifactId>
            <version>4.1.2</version>
        </dependency>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.jboss.spec.javax.rmi</groupId>
            <artifactId>jboss-rmi-api_1.0_spec</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.2.Final</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>
    <build>
        <finalName>ROOT</finalName>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <encoding>${project.encoding}</encoding>
                    <source>1.8</source>
                    <target>1.8</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-war-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.2.0</version>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
    <profiles>
<!-- TODO: Add OpenShift profile here -->
    </profiles>
</project>
```

## Additional Information

Note that by switching to `jakarta.jakartaee-web-api`, you may need to ensure that your application only uses the APIs included in the web profile. If your application uses APIs outside of the web profile, you may need to add additional dependencies or switch back to the full `jakarta.jakartaee-api`.
